entry.title: New Interfaces for Musical Expression (NIME) 2018
entry.content:
One of our past postdoc researcher Gerard Roma presented ‘‘Live Repurposing of Sounds: MIR Explorations with Personal and Crowdsourced Databases’’ at NIME 2018 in USA, on 3-6 June 2018.

You can read about more details here.

entry.title: AES 2018 Milan Convention
entry.content:
MARuSS project organised a workshop session at the AES Milan Convention in May 2018:

Audio Repurposing Using Source Separation

Check for more details in Phil Coleman’s blog post here.

You can download the presentations by the panelists below:

Sound Source Separation: An Introduction, E. Cano

Evaluation of source separation for use in object-based audio production, J. Francombe

Source Separation for dialogue enhancement in broadcast applications, J. Paulus

Perceptual Evaluation of Source Separation: Current Issues with Listening Test Design and Repurposing, C. Kim
